title: StreetKhana: AI-Powered Food Discovery
subtitle: Connecting food lovers with authentic street vendors through intelligent recommendations
overview: StreetKhana aimed to solve the discovery problem for street food enthusiasts by creating an AI-powered platform that connects users with local vendors based on preferences, location, and real-time availability.
problem: India is home to an estimated 2 million street food vendors, offering a rich and diverse culinary experience across cities and towns. Despite the widespread love for street food, people often struggle to discover the best and most hygienic options nearby—especially when craving local specialties or traveling to a new city. This highlights a significant discovery gap in the street food ecosystem. To bridge this gap, we envision building a street food finder app that enables users to seamlessly explore, locate, and engage with top-rated street vendors based on their location, preferences, and real-time availability. To develop an outstanding product that street food lovers genuinely value, we must first understand the market landscape—mapping key players, vendors, and competitors, and assessing current solutions. From there, we will form hypotheses around the ideal product experience, conduct both user and competitor research to validate assumptions, and identify distinct user segments along with their pain points. Based on user personas, we’ll design and prioritize features, define the MVP scope, outline a high-level system design, and create wireframes with intuitive UI/UX. We will map the end-to-end user journey, define measurable success metrics including a north star and supporting KPIs, and structure a viable monetization plan. Finally, we’ll identify potential risks—such as vendor onboarding challenges or user trust—and propose mitigation strategies to ensure the long-term success of the product.

title: Hinge App Store Ratings Recovery
subtitle: Strategic UX intervention to recover from declining app store ratings
team: Product Manager, UX Designer, Data Analyst
overview: Hinge faced declining app store ratings due to user experience issues in their onboarding flow and matching algorithm. This case study details the systematic approach to identifying and resolving core user friction points.
problem: Hinge app ratings had declined to 2.8 stars with users complaining about poor matching quality, complicated onboarding, and lack of meaningful connections. The declining ratings were affecting organic discovery and user acquisition.

title: BookMyShow Ticketing UX Redesign
subtitle: Optimizing high-demand event booking flow for better conversion
overview: BookMyShow needed to optimize their ticket booking flow for high-demand events where server load and user urgency created friction points that led to booking abandonment and user frustration.
problem: During high-demand events, BookMyShow experienced significant booking abandonment due to slow loading times, complex navigation, and unclear seat availability. Users were frustrated with the multi-step process during peak traffic periods.

title: Generative UI Prototyping Tool
subtitle: AI-powered wireframe generation for rapid product development
team: Product Manager, Frontend Developer, AI Engineer, UX Designer
overview: Created an AI-powered prototyping tool that allows early-stage founders and product managers to generate professional wireframes and UI mockups through natural language prompts, dramatically reducing the time from idea to testable prototype.
problem: Early-stage founders and non-technical product managers struggled to quickly visualize and test their product ideas. Traditional prototyping tools required design skills and significant time investment, creating a barrier between concept and validation.
research: Interviewed 40 early-stage founders about prototyping challenges
Analyzed time spent on initial design iterations vs. development
Studied existing no-code design tools and their limitations
researched AI-generated design capabilities and best practices

personas.name: Emma, Solo Founder
personas.description: Non-technical founder with limited design budget
frustrations: Steep learning curve for design tools

solution: Natural language processing to interpret design requirements
OpenAI GPT-4 integration for intelligent layout generation
Figma plugin for seamless design workflow integration
Component library with modern UI patterns and Tailwind CSS
Version control and collaboration features for team feedback
results: 10x faster prototype creation (2 hours vs. 20 hours)
85% reduction in design costs for early-stage startups
92% user satisfaction score in beta testing
Featured in 5 major product design publications

title: Case Study: Credit Card Origination Platform
subtitle: Building a modular, real-time credit card origination solution on top of legacy LOS
team: Associate Product Manager, Credit Risk Lead, Compliance Officer, Backend Engineers, Frontend Engineers, DevOps, UX Designer
outcome: 42% approval rate, sub‑15‑second decisions, 19% abandonment reduction
overview: We extended our existing mortgage‑and‑consumer‑loan LOS (NetOxygen) with a microservices–based credit card origination platform. Features include a tiered credit decision engine, dynamic offer personalization, cross‑sell workflows, and full API integration for rapid product launches.
problem: Our NetOxygen LOS was robust for mortgages and consumer loans but inflexible for credit card products and digital channels. Siloed processes led to high mobile abandonment (>60%), low approval rates (~23%), and 3+ week product launches.
research: Analyzed funnel drop‑off points: bureau pull & offer selection steps
Benchmarked 5 challenger banks and fintechs on digital decisioning speed
Interviewed 30 risk and compliance stakeholders to map regulatory requirements
Studied legacy LOS integration patterns and migration constraints

personas.name: Jordan, Digital Banking Customer
personas.description: A tech‑savvy millennial seeking instant credit prequalification via mobile.
goals: Get an instant eligibility check without harming credit score
frustrations: Long manual forms and hard credit pulls
No alternative offers if initially declined

personas.name: Riley, Credit Risk Manager
personas.description: Responsible for maintaining portfolio health while maximizing approvals.
goals: Configure tier thresholds without code deployments
Generate audit‑ready logs for regulatory review
frustrations: Slow change cycles for rule updates
Opaque decision logic in legacy systems
Lack of real‑time monitoring on decision outcomes

solution: Built a JSON‑schema driven eligibility gateway with preliminary filters (age, residency, blacklists).
Implemented bureau integrator adapters (soft/hard pulls) with circuit breakers and fallbacks.
Developed a rules‑driven Decision Engine that maps FICO + custom risk attributes to A–D tiers.
Created a CMS‑backed Offer Personalization Engine integrated with Docutech for real‑time disclosures.
Engineered a Cross‑Sell & Partner Routing service to present fallback credit products.
Extended NetOxygen LOS via idempotent REST APIs and webhook sync for issuance and manual underwriting.
Containerized microservices on AWS Fargate, with GitHub Actions CI/CD, Terraform IaC, Prometheus/Grafana monitoring.
results: Onboarded 8 issuers with configurable rule sets

title: GenAI Real Estate Lending
subtitle: Smarter loan decisions using LLMs and dynamic borrower intelligence
team: Product Manager, GenAI Engineer, Risk Analyst
problem: Legacy loan systems failed to account for nuanced borrower behavior and contextual risk factors.
research: Evaluated loan applications with high default risk
Interviewed 15 loan underwriters on decision complexity
Benchmarked success of LLMs in legal/financial NLP

personas.name: Rajesh, Loan Officer
personas.description: Assesses real estate borrowers and approves large loans

solution: LangChain agent to validate borrower info and property trends
Creditworthiness scoring enhanced with market intelligence
results: 30% more loan approvals with same default rate
Enhanced trust in GenAI models by risk committee

title: Ovis CRM for Fitness Coaches
subtitle: A lightweight CRM to power solopreneurs in the fitness industry
team: Solo Founder, React Developer, Product Designer
outcome: Successfully launched MVP with 50+ fitness coaches
problem: Fitness professionals relied on spreadsheets and WhatsApp, leading to inefficiencies and lost clients.
research: Interviewed 25 gym trainers and personal coaches
Benchmarked features from fitness CRMs like Trainerize

personas.name: Ravi, Gym Coach
personas.description: Tracks client progress, workouts, and payments manually

solution: Client tracker with notes and progress logs
results: Received interest from local gyms for white-labeling
